conclusion: Analyze the motion of the balls on the inclined plane to determine the number of small steel balls rolling on top of ball A.
The distance between two consecutive positions of the balls is affected by their acceleration.
The formula for the change in distance between two consecutive positions (Δd) in uniformly accelerated motion is Δd = a ⋅ T^2.
The difference in distances between consecutive intervals is 20 cm - 15 cm = 5 cm.
Using T = 0.1 s, the acceleration a is calculated as a = Δd / T^2 = 5 / 0.01 = 500 cm/s^2.
The velocity of ball B is found using the average velocity formula: v_B = (AB + BC) / 2T = 35 / 0.2 = 175 cm/s.
Using the formula v = a ⋅ t, solve for the time t that ball B has been rolling: t = v_B / a = 175 / 500 = 0.35 s.
Since each ball is released every 0.1 seconds, the number of balls released in 0.35 seconds is 0.35 / 0.1 = 3.5.
Since we can't have a fraction of a ball, consider 3 full releases.
There are 3 balls released by the time ball B has rolled for 0.35 seconds, which means there are 2 balls on top of ball A.
Final Answer: There are 2 small steel balls rolling on top of ball A.
